response.answer_text: Given the very low probability that Trump will be reelected, this question is somewhat meaningless. 2020 Election Forecast From this report: "Joe Biden leads by double digits in national polls, and state-level polling is only slightly closer. In fact, Biden’s lead is so large, traditionally red states like Georgia, Iowa, Ohio and Texas might now go blue." One of the unarguable facts about Trump is that he doesn't and can’t change. How he was behaving in January of 2017 when he took office is quite the same as today so the idea of there being something he could "do" to become a better president is ridiculous because it would never happen. So let's talk about how he's actually viewed in terms of rankings of presidential greatness. About a year and a half ago, a survey of scholars put Trump as the third worst president in history. Survey of scholars places Trump as third worst president of all time Now let's look at what has been happening since that time. The coronavirus is the major event, where Trump demonstrated such a profound lack of leadership and endless, harmful lies that his mendacity undoubtedly led to the needless deaths of thousands of Americans. Due to Trump's incompetence in dealing with the virus, the economy -- which he considers his claim to fame despite the reality that he largely inherited it from Obama -- has cratered, leaving millions out of work, untold numbers of companies closing and other carnage. There are many other examples of Trump's manifest failures as president but such a listing would take too many pages. In the final analysis, he will undoubtedly go down as the worst president in history without much close competition. The only place he would be considered the best president in history -- or even in the top 10 -- is in his own diseased mind.
